page.title: 05Tourism
page.content: Dereham is not a tourist centre in the accepted sense, but it serves as a central point from which visitors to Norfolk can make their expeditions to some of the tourist attractions which are plentiful in the County. It is within easy reach of the coast, the capital city of Norwich with its fine Cathedral, and some of the country's loveliest stately homes, such as Houghton Hall, Holkham Hall and Blickling Hall. Dereham itself has its buildings of historic interest such as the birthplace of George Borrow, the tomb of the poet Cowper and St. Withburga's Well. There are three well-appointed hotels and a number of private homes which cater for short-stay visitors.
